attributes.action: Ban utility companies from charging a fee for customers to receive paper bills
attributes.additional_details:
Companies, including BT, are now charging as much as £3 per paper bill that their customers receive. This is an outrageous fee for utility giants to charge and it is customers who have to bear the brunt.

At present, there is no cap on how much these companies can charge for paper bills. A ban would prevent utility companies from charging this fee.


References

1 - https://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/news/article-6748633/The-paper-bill-rip-Telecoms-giants-charging-36-year-posted-statements.html
attributes.background:
Around 4.5 million UK adults did not use the internet in 2018.

Most utility companies are now charging an additional fee, currently uncapped, for customers who wish to receive paper bills. This is simply not fair on those who do not have access to the internet.
